"My way to play is better than yours so sit down and shut up"

snippet.textDisplay:
People like you ruined people for me.  I'm absolutely sick of all the comments that amount to "My way to play is better than yours so sit down and shut up".  Besides, my comment was 10 months ago - you honestly went looking for something to be pissed at?
Real shame you can't tell the difference between "personally think" and "this is the right way".
As for me: Who cares what I think?  All I'm doing is making a sarcastic, reflective comment based on yours.

See how it works?
snippet.textOriginal:
People like you ruined people for me.  I'm absolutely sick of all the comments that amount to "My way to play is better than yours so sit down and shut up".  Besides, my comment was 10 months ago - you honestly went looking for something to be pissed at?

snippet.textDisplay:
People like you ruined gaming for people like me. I'm absolutely sick of all the streamlining. Besides, those games you listed ARE streamlined, none have had the depth of Symphony of the Night
Real shame it didn't have a hard mode though and soul steal was basically a cheat code. 

As for recent handhelds: Order of Occlesia kicked ass. All it needed was a bigger castle and perhaps a little more gameplay depth.
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay: I personally think they spend too much time on creative gameplay elements, when they should focus on making the gameplay streamlined, and better for 3D games.  I mean, I loved the DSS cards from Circle of the Moon, and liked the Book/Subweapon system of Harmony of Dissonance, and the Souls of Aria/Dawn were neat, but the other handhelds of late feel kinda...forced to me.
snippet.textOriginal: I personally think they spend too much time on creative gameplay elements, when they should focus on making the gameplay streamlined, and better for 3D games.  I mean, I loved the DSS cards from Circle of the Moon, and liked the Book/Subweapon system of Harmony of Dissonance, and the Souls of Aria/Dawn were neat, but the other handhelds of late feel kinda...forced to me.

snippet.textDisplay: oh trust me its in this game as well. i grew up with all those older games as well. simon's quest, super castlevania, SOTN... and i gave the newer ones a shot just because i loved the series up to that point. while some of the soundtracks lack the flow and old Gothic feeling that the older games had, most of them are VERY good additions to the series and extremely worth listening to.

snippet.textDisplay:
@alxxz hi yes this IS  a Castlevania game. It tells the story of the 1st Belmont and Creator of the Belmont Clan: Leon Belmont.
It's...not as big as SotN... it has 7 stages and mostly of the stages have 2 parts...the stages are actually pretty short tho... 
Secrets? yes it has some: Secret bosses, hidden weapons and itens and a few secret areas.
This game is pretty fun to play and it isn't as gory and repetitive as GoW...and the music just makes you wanna play some more :D
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay:
Even if you dont care, I'll tell ya anyway, so other who don't know can se this too ;P

Every enemy have fixed drops.. upp to two drops each, some enemies drop nothing.
There is a bestiary in game that tell what they drop, if they have droped anything up til the point you look it up.
If they have not droped anything yet there will be marked with "?????" so you'll know if they can drop anything.

Every Castlevania game post Symphony of the nighty work like that.
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay: Now I haven't played all Casltevania games, though I'm a big fan of em, but it could be that Sonia was dropped because having her as the heir of the vampire killer would've essentially killed off the Belmont clan, since by European tradition, last names are passed from father to child, not from the mother. So if Sonia had descendants, they wouldn't be Belmonts anymore, maybe by blood they would but not by name. Like I said, IDK why IGA wrote her out, but I think that may have been a reason.
snippet.textOriginal: Now I haven't played all Casltevania games, though I'm a big fan of em, but it could be that Sonia was dropped because having her as the heir of the vampire killer would've essentially killed off the Belmont clan, since by European tradition, last names are passed from father to child, not from the mother. So if Sonia had descendants, they wouldn't be Belmonts anymore, maybe by blood they would but not by name. Like I said, IDK why IGA wrote her out, but I think that may have been a reason.

snippet.textDisplay:
Funny how 'Lament of Innocence' often got criticized for being just another DMC clone. Diehard 2D CV fans simply wouldn't be pleased, I guess.

I still liked playing this PS2 'CastleVania' title. Great action-oriented gameplay that actually worked in 3D.

Sweet BGM, by the way! One of my favorites in this game

snippet.textDisplay: Forest of Jigramunt was pretty cool. Best music of all time goes to the original Castlevania in my opinion. That's what's great about Castlevania so much great music and so many great games. Good chatting fellow Belmont ;)

snippet.textDisplay:
Yeah, Castlevania 64 is the best 3D game from the saga. Curse of Darkness has beautiful scenarios and the best music of all time, but it's missing a bit of freedom in exploration.

And yes, Anti-soul is pretty much techno. Listen to Forest of Jigramunt if you can, you won't regret it.
snippet.textOriginal:
Yeah, Castlevania 64 is the best 3D game from the saga. Curse of Darkness has beautiful scenarios and the best music of all time, but it's missing a bit of freedom in exploration.

And yes, Anti-soul is pretty much techno. Listen to Forest of Jigramunt if you can, you won't regret it.

snippet.textDisplay: Baljhet is definitely ethnic at parts such as the voice parts arab/serb or something. You're right, it's not techno. I definitely get a techno-style vibe from Anti-soul though. I'll have to check out Forest of Jigramunt. CoD is the one of the only castlevania's I have played that I don't feel I need to play. LoI was good, but I don't like that style of game. It should be more exploratory. Like the 64 version, but better (64 version was kinda lame).
snippet.textOriginal: Baljhet is definitely ethnic at parts such as the voice parts arab/serb or something. You're right, it's not techno. I definitely get a techno-style vibe from Anti-soul though. I'll have to check out Forest of Jigramunt. CoD is the one of the only castlevania's I have played that I don't feel I need to play. LoI was good, but I don't like that style of game. It should be more exploratory. Like the 64 version, but better (64 version was kinda lame).

snippet.textDisplay:
Baljhet Mountains beats the vast majority of VGM including Castlevania, it's an excellent track. The best from CoD is Forest of Jigramunt, then comes Baljhet Mountains.

But it's not techno. The first seconds are ethnic and the rest is just normal with harpsichord doing the melody, strings and a not so traditional percussion, but definitely not techno.
snippet.textOriginal:
Baljhet Mountains beats the vast majority of VGM including Castlevania, it's an excellent track. The best from CoD is Forest of Jigramunt, then comes Baljhet Mountains.

But it's not techno. The first seconds are ethnic and the rest is just normal with harpsichord doing the melody, strings and a not so traditional percussion, but definitely not techno.

snippet.textDisplay: I have to disagree with you. I believe this track is the best from Lament of Innocence. While the techno feel isn't commonplace in Castlevania games, it fit this stage very well. I'm a big fan of most of the games music before this. Anti-soul Mysteries Lab is the best from LoI, then Leons Theme. Baljhet Mountains beats them both though. Out of the techno castlevania songs, those are the only 3 I like.
snippet.textOriginal: I have to disagree with you. I believe this track is the best from Lament of Innocence. While the techno feel isn't commonplace in Castlevania games, it fit this stage very well. I'm a big fan of most of the games music before this. Anti-soul Mysteries Lab is the best from LoI, then Leons Theme. Baljhet Mountains beats them both though. Out of the techno castlevania songs, those are the only 3 I like.
